name: Melia Las Dunas

reviews.text: Melia Las Dunas went beyond my expectations. I have travelled to Cuba a few times and have stayed at various types of resorts and so far Las Dunas has been the best in Cuba.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.text: The resort is beautiful, maintained well and kept very clean. The resort is also run very well too. We had no issues with our oceanview room, rm 5125 was clean on arrival and stayed clean everyday. Our maid Yaliceth was amazing. She cleaned our room from top to bottom every day, and left us wonderful surprises everyday as well! She has been the most thorough cleaning maid we have ever had and she worked very hard. She was wonderful, I wish her all the best! The gents come to restock your fridge usually in the evening around the supper hour, we never had an issue getting anything. The view from this room was to die for and it was close to the beach and all amenities. This resort has tons to offer. The beach is breathtaking, lots of chairs available, and more palapas on the beach than any other resort I have been to. The pools are wonderful, really enjoyed the quiet pool and they are kept very clean.
reviews.title: Wasn't that bad

reviews.text: The restaurants are great and so was the food. The buffet is your typical resort buffet but very large and had many choices for all tastes, a large buffet is great. If you are a picky eater than regardless where you go, you will have an issue. The a la carte restaurants were wonderful, the Italian restaurant was really romantic with amazing pizza, bruschetta, and mozzarella sticks and the Romantico had the best Chateaubriand I have ever had and while you are there they have a piano player to add to the ambiance.
reviews.title: Used to be 5 star but still a good solid 4.5!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The nightly entertainment shows were ok, I have seen better but the live bands were amazing. Every night after the show they have bands playing salsa, bachata, and merengue. These bands were great. After the bands Carlos plays the sax and It is a must to sit by a listen to him play if you enjoy the sax. There are tons of bars to enjoy, the lobby bar is open 24hrs and has the premium alcohol. There is a 24hr bar which serves food and if you are a Corona beer drinker, you can get it there.
reviews.title: Amazing, Beautiful and of course it's in Cuba!

reviews.text: Now I am going to give some info on the Pueblo Markets. There is a little confusion regarding the Pueblo. There are 2 Pueblos. There is one literally right next to Las Dunas, you can walk there or take the bus, this is called the Las Dunas Pueblo with bowling, cafe, club, shopping. Then there is the Pueblo Estrella which you need to take cab or the bus for $1peso as it's 10 mins away. At the Pueblo Estrella there is shopping for souveniers(good prices) piano bar, jazz bar, restaurants, bowling etc.
reviews.title: Yet another great holiday,,,,,,,,,,

reviews.text: The check-in was good – the bell boys from MLD meet you at the airport and hand you an envelope with your keys, wrist bands and hotel information put your cases on the coach and when you arrive at the hotel they give you a welcome drink and you are greeted by dancers. Your cases are delivered to your room later – tip here if you are arriving in the evening is to buy some bug spray at the airport (cannot take it though security as it is over 100 ml) because as it was late when we got there we just wanted to go to eat then go to bed and our cases had not arrived – we went without any spray and we got a few bites – most other people we spoke to said they had had the same problem.
reviews.title: Good place for a relaxing holiday

reviews.text: Once we were using mossie spray every night we only got a couple of bites although we did see some people who had lots and some people needed medical treatment for them. Just take all precautions and you should be ok.
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.liked: — nice large rooms clean and well maintained

reviews.text: Rooms – had a standard room, which was large and light with a huge king sized bed, coffee maker, tv, phone, safe, hairdryer, etc. Fridge was restocked each day with water, beer and soft drinks. Maid service everyday and most days we got towel art etc.
reviews.title: amazing !!

likes.disliked: — sports facilities could be better organised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are Tbeautiful, loads of gardeners always working hard to keep it tidy.
reviews.title: 4.5 Star hotel??? Give me a break!!!!

reviews.text: The buffet restaurant has loads of choice (don’t know how anyone can complain about the food). Fresh pancakes, waffles, omelettes etc for breakfast. Meats, fish etc cooked to order for lunch and dinner. Lots of meat, fish, pasta, salads and desserts to choose from.
reviews.title: hated it hated it dont go

reviews.text: Our group of 15 people travelled there from Aug 2. We had the wedding of our dream at Melia Las Dunas on the 8 of August. After the wedding, everyone left and we - the newlywed couple stayed for one more week. This hotel really did a wonderful job in everything, from food to service to entertainment.... I have to say thank you a thousand times that you guys at this resorts had made all of my guests an unforgetable impression. Everyone in this resorts is super friendly. Lian- the wedding coordinator - she is such a sweatheart and has taking care of us for every single detail, even after the wedding. She personally gave us the certificate and arrange for us a marverlous honeymoon dinner at the Romatica restaurant.
reviews.title: Perfect Weddingmoon

likes.disliked: — air conditioning is not too cold, but hey, it 's August

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To make it short and sweet, I would recommend this resorts to any one, for any reason, of any occasion. Just come and you won't be disappointed
reviews.title: Fabulous holiday! Want to go back..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed in this hotel from June 23rd to July 7th and booked through Thomas Cook. I found the flight very tedious, not just because it is 10 hours but because of the poor in-flight entertainment and not being able to sit by my fiance due to 'hardly any families of 3 being booked on', this may not have been entirely TC's fault but it made the flight even more of a strain sitting in silence in a cramped seat (they've apparently taken seats out to create more legroom but goodness knows what it was like before!)
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Brilliant Holiday, Lovely People!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We touched down on time in Santa Clara airport which is small but efficient and we were quickly ushered onto our coaches to the hotels. They have the clever system of giving out room keys and hotel maps in envelopes on the coach to save queuing up in the hotel reception, and also write your room number on your luggage for the bell boys to take to your rooms when you arrive, leaving you free to wander around the hotel grounds or grab a cocktail from the bar.
reviews.title: Glad to be home :)

likes.liked: — The Beach and our favourite pool :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The journey to the hotel from the airport is 1 hour 30 mins but this went quickly as we were shown a video of the hotel and we got to see the 'real cuba' as we drove through quaint towns and villages. Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted with dancers and a (watered down) cocktail for everyone which was very welcome in the hot heat.
reviews.title: Wonderful people

reviews.text: Stayed at Melia Las Dunsa from August 24 to August 31, 2008.
reviews.title: nice resort

reviews.text: In short form:
reviews.title: Not the best vacation!

reviews.text: - Huge hotel takes about 2 or 3 days to know where everything is.
reviews.title: Nice resort for kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Bring Canadian Dollars, you get penalized if you bring US Dollars (even though the american $ is worth more you get alot less for it.)
reviews.title: Great resort but not for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I converted $100 CAN and got $83 CUC.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Holiday!

reviews.text: Just got back from a one week stay at mld, oct 29 nov 5. First and foremost upgrade your room from standard to superior befor you leave if nothing else, are first room was in block 53 ground floor rooms even though we had requested 2nd floor befor going, we were traveling with another couple and had are teenage boys booked into their own room, in total we had 3 dumpy dirty broken down bug infested moldy cigar stinking rooms! Needless to say I spoke to front desk immediately about being moved but they could not do anything till morning so I spent first night sitting in a chair I was not getting in that bed no way no how, the door in one room had no lock, the other room had a broken safe, other room had broken shower head. Next morn first thing we wen't to desk to get rooms fixed and of course they did not have 3 rooms in the same block unless we paid to upgrade what a surprise! Even though we had booked months in advance they just simply didn't care so 500 dollars Canadian later we went to block 47 rooms 21 22 24 what a difference an upgrade makes even the toilet paper in this room was better we had a view of the ocean, room was clean,bright balcony with table and chair it was a complete 360 from the standard room so do yourself a favor and upgrade your room. That being said you make your vacation and we had a fabulous time. food was plentiful although boring after a couple of days, beach was nice but covered in stinky seaweed the whole week never cleaned but we enjoyed the warm water and swimming in the waves,local drinks were plentiful but you had to pay extra for premium alcohol, we were only able to book one a la carte even though we were entitled to 4 and the man booking restaurants was not at all helpful we figured out on are own that the restaurants were only working at half capacity some were being renovated and others were simply closed and because we spent first morning changing the rooms we missed out on booking restaurants tough luck yet again! But we ate at buffet and it was fine just repetitive. Adult relax pool was very nice went to play ball in activity pool with boys to find they had drained it to fix broken tiles that every one had been complaining about in past reviews so good news is pool is fixed but sucked for our boys since they had no pool for activities and beach was red flag every day of our trip so we allowed them to play ball in adult pool, sorry if this interrupted anyone's sleep but we were not told the pool would be drained during our stay. All and all it appears we went mld during the clean up and repair week Befor busy season starts this is fine had we known about this befor booking and we could have made a choice to stay under these circumstances but we were not given this choice. Last thoughts on mld te resort is ok not a 4 star not bad but not great just ok we had a fun relaxing vaca because WE made it fun not the resort,we won't return this resort for above mentioned reasons and many more that I didn't write about just to long already just remember count on yourself to make your vacation fun.AND UPGRADE YOUR ROOM!!!
reviews.title: Make sure you upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Cuba 10 times, 3 times in Santa Clara, and found this facility to be one of the best they have. It was a special treat to get your wristbands and rooms assigned on the bus so you do not have to worry about checking in, everything is taken care of for you! What a difference that makes.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved the food at this resort. The buffet had something for everyone. They had a fried rice station, a pizza station, a sushi station, fresh fish station, pasta station and so many others. There was so much to choose from. My favourite was dessert ( banana flambe) :).. We went to the Italian restaurant and had lasagna my husband a steak and it was great. We also had an anniversary dinner planned for us which was very thoughtful and romanitic. We also got a special invitation for a VIP cocktail from the general management in which we had the opportunity to meet the manager of Melia Las Dunas, this was a nice touch. Forgot to mention the Beer Garden which offered a wide variety of brand name beer in bottles and cans, and you could even grab a bite to eat there!
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: We love the Ocean and so the beach was fantastic for us! I walked for miles on it every morning, and took dance classes on the beach as well (so much fun!). The water is so clear! The sand is white and stretches for miles and the water is warm. There are plenty of loungers available both on the beach and at the pools, so finding one was never an issue.
reviews.title: Nice stay, nice staff!

reviews.text: All the staff were amazing. The entertainment was great- fashion shows- sax player- band etc were great. We had so much fun with many of the staff in the lobby bar and the buffet restaurant. Claudia, Edward, Jesus were the best...............and I would like to give a special thank you to Miriela Pombal, the sales assistant at Melia Las Dunas, for making this vacation and our anniversary wonderful.
reviews.title: great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a beautiful week. Have to say that the weather was just amazing, sunny every day.
reviews.title: Nice and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the friendliest place in Cuba we have been so far. The staff is friendly, they smile, some of them even speak french which really amazed us. We never had to wait to get served at the bars. The A la carte restaurants are good. It is great to see that they are putting that little extra effort in serving you. The "Romantico" was the beast for us. We went twice and the pianist is very talented. The food at the buffet is OK, dont expect much and you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever !!!!

likes.liked: — Everything, but the beach really is something else :)

reviews.text: The beach is very nice but not what we expected. The sand is white the water is aqua but somehow the beach area must have been damaged in results of a storm, not sure. If you take the time to walk a bit you will find amazing little area to enjoy the beach. There is a few bars on the beach so it is never a problem getting a drink but you have to get back on the hotel grouds to find a bathroom unless you room is near the beach entrances.
reviews.title: Wonderful Dream!

reviews.text: Be prepared to walk, the hotel ground is quite large and you can easily take a wrong turn, especially on first days. The little train does not go by regularly.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

likes.liked: — How friendly the staff was and the amazing beach
likes.disliked: — Could have had better house wine

reviews.text: The rooms a good, not a problem having hot water at the end of the day. I was hoping to get towel arts every day but got none even when I tipped or left goodies on the pillow.
reviews.title: Nice vacation but......

likes.liked: — The beach and the gardens of the property
likes.disliked: — The food at the buffet restaurants

reviews.text: What a great place to visit. Everyone was so nice. The service was great, and special thanks to Yireni at the Panio Bar, Manual and Andiery at the International Buffet. Food was good, and the hotel grounds are beautiful. The water and beach is very nice. Its hard to know where you want to be at the beach or at the great pools. This was my second visit and was better than the first. This place just keeps getting better. We had room 4526 and up stairs room and was very nice. Can't wait to return. Will be back with friends in the spring and or the fall.
reviews.title: Special Vacation

reviews.text: We stayed at the MLD at the end of October 2011, a party of 12 (67 - 3 years), and throughly enjoyed our stay, it was our first time to Cuba but will definately go again.
reviews.title: Lovely Cuba!

reviews.text: Flew with Thompsons from London, flight out there were only 78 people on board, this was heaven, flight back was full, but staff were still very good and we had plenty of space (premium cabin).
reviews.title: Poor Man's Vacation

reviews.text: The transfer to the hotel is quite long, but it seemed to go pretty fast, although the causeway out to the cayos goes on forever!
reviews.title: Beaches here went to the top of our list. . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very nice, I did'nt expect it to be amazing as this is Cuba, and it would be unfair to compare it to an equal star rating in Europe. We always found the public areas very clean and the grounds are lovely, the staff obviously work very hard. We did'nt manage to book any of the resturants, but the buffet suited are large group, I have to say that the food was always hot and served by very happy freindy people, we never had to wait for drinks or cutlery and all the waiting staff were great, the resort was quiet so maybe this is why?
reviews.title: terrible service

reviews.text: We were their for two weeks from the 8th oct 2011, the place was great, my wife and i were renewing our wedding vows etc and the staff etc could not be nicer, special thanks to maria elena the wedding co ordinator who was most helpful. I dont need to put a lot here as many have already said it better, i will be back in a couple of years as the place was first class.
reviews.title: Great ! what more can i say.

reviews.text: Those of you who are considering or thinking about going to the Melia Las Dunas and are looking for an isolated chill out place where you can relax eat, drink and be merry then this is the place for you. The main reception complex is beautiful and in full splendour with a large theatre for entertainment laid on nightly with a large bar so you do not go short of drinks. The Music Bands are a must to listen and dance to. The food is beyond reproach within the large buffet restaurant where the staff ensure you are well looked after. I am not one for giving tips/gratuities anywhere in the world but providing the service is what I expect it to be then I do relent at times. However whilst in Cuba please give small tips/gratuities around 1 to 3 CUC’s as the Cubans who are a happy people, polite and courteous are on a very low salary, around 20 CUC’s monthly that’s about £14.00 a month to us, they are most grateful and they will provide you a good service at all times. It also has a number of A Le Carte restaurants , all being nice with an ambiance that you would expect. The food is again beyond reproach though on some occasions I left feeling hungry but hey! You end up eating too much in the course of the two weeks so on the odd night it is good to eat light.
reviews.title: What an Experience

reviews.text: The beach is great, the sea a lovely blue/green and like walking into a bath, if you are a beachy person then the shades on the beach go very quick so be on your toes. Remember I said isolated, there is nowhere to go from Cayo Santa Maria except a little place called Pueblo which is a hop skip and a jump away or a bus ride from the resort which has shops, restaurants and a few market stalls with local wears, also not far away is a Dolphin Sea Centre which I cannot comment on as I did not experience it. Your nearest big town is Santa Clara in fact where you land on arrival which is 1hr 50 mins away by coach or car but take advice before going, and arrange a tour. We went to Havana for three days a two night and stayed at the Hotel Nacional that entailed a 50 min flight and all transfers from hotel to airport to hotel with Breakfast and Dinner Buffet style for £227.00 each. Great value though the Hotel Nacional buffet food at dinner was not up to our standards so we had breakfast which was fair and we ate out in the day and evenings in a lovely little restaurant Café El Mercurio in San Francisco Plaza in the old town where the staff and food were brilliant, so if you are ever in Havana give it a try you won’t regret it. Please get the most from Havana, it is a must, do the bus tour for a few pesos and then go to the large castle/fort by bus T3 from Plaza Central where they do the nine pm gun fire every night. Over all Cuba is a great place to go with a very low crime rate friendly and accommodating people. Well Done Cuba
reviews.title: WOW, what a resort!!!!

reviews.text: What can I say, the reviews I read that were negative, I can't figure out where they actually stayed, because all I can say is this resort is incredible!
reviews.title: Hewi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In: the best ever, we were checked in on the bus ride to the hotel, this is the way to do it!
reviews.title: Okay, but you can do better elsewhere

aka: Melia Las Dunas Hotel Cayo Santa Maria
